RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Prof. Tommaso Macr recebeu seu PhD em 2011, SISSA em Trieste (Itlia). Trabalhou por dois anos no Instituto Max Planck para a Fsica de Sistemas Complexos em Dresden (Alemanha) como Guest Scientist. Em 2014 ele obteve uma posio de joint postdoc entre o instituto QSTAR em Florena e o Instituto Max Planck de ptica Quntica em Munique. Desde maro 2015 Tommaso faz parte do Departamento de Fsica da UFRN em Natal e professor permanente da ps-graduao em Fsica da UFRN. 

Atualmente lder do grupo de pesquisa Quantech (www.statphys.fisica.ufrn.br/macri). A atividade de pesquisa do Prof. Tommaso Macr focada na fsica dos tomos ultrafrios. Seus principais interesses so os sistemas com interaes de longo alcance (tomos de Rydberg , tomos dipolares e molculas polares) e suas aplicaes na tecnologia e simulao quntica. Tommaso tambm pesquisa a dinmica dos modelos relativisticos com tomos ultrafrios confinados em armadilhas pticas.

 grantee do Instituto Serrapilheira (www.serrapilheira.org/pesquisadores/tommaso-macri) e membro do advisory board da International Artificial Intelligence and Quantum Technology Foundation (www.inaiqt.com).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Prof. Tommaso Macr received his PhD in 2011, SISSA in Trieste (Italy). He worked for two years at the Max Planck Institute for Complex Systems Physics in Dresden (Germany) as a Guest Scientist. In 2014 he obtained a joint postdoc position between the QSTAR institute in Florence and the Max Planck Institute for Quantum Optics in Munich. Since March 2015 Tommaso has been part of the Physics Department at UFRN in Natal and a permanent professor at the UFRN graduate course in Physics.

He is currently the leader of the Quantech research group (www.statphys.fisica.ufrn.br/macri). The research activity of Prof. Tommaso Macr is focused on the physics of ultra-cold atoms. His main interests are systems with long-range interactions (Rydberg atoms, dipolar atoms and polar molecules) and their applications in technology and quantum simulation. Tommaso also researches the dynamics of relativistic models with ultra-cold atoms confined in optical traps.

He is a grantee of Instituto Serrapilheira (www.serrapilheira.org/pesquisadores/tommaso-macri) and member of the advisory board of the International Artificial Intelligence and Quantum Technology Foundation (www.inaiqt.com).
